fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Confluence , eg: Confluence 5.10.6
 # Do not allow exported XML files to be downloadable from within Confluence
 # Configure User Language to non-english language. Eg: German   !UserProfile_language.png|width=519,height=104!
 # Generate a new XML backup via Administrations > Backup & Restore > click on "Backup" button

 
h3. Expected Behaviour

Confluence shows the path to the directory where the XML backup is generated

!Correct_Behaviour_in_English.png|width=1380,height=338!

 
h3. Actual Behaviour

Confluence provide link to download the XML backup. However, the link contain incorrect URL which are like: 

!InGerman1.png|width=1209,height=390!

The download link is incorrect and it appear like $Confluence_URL_without_context_path/$PathToConfluenceHome/temp/xmlexport-20161104-203402-7.zip

 
h3. Workaround

Allow XML backup to be downloaded from within Confluence by setting the {{admin.ui.allow.manual.backup.download}} to True. Refer to section [Enabling Backup Path Configuration|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+Backups#ConfiguringBackups-EnablingBackupPathConfiguration] . This would provide two options to download the XML backup. The second link is the only working URL

 

!Workaround.png|width=937,height=342!  
h3.  

Additional Notes
 * Tested and confirmed that it is affecting users that is using Spanish , German, French
fields.summary: Link to Download XML Backup is Incorrect When Using Non-English Language

h4. Problem Definition
As a Confluence user who edit e.g. a meeting protocol agenda shortly before the meeting starts, i want to push out these informations to all mentioned users on that page. I want to get people notified who didn't watch the current page or whole space.

When i have a long list of attendes (e.g. 20 colleagues), it take a while to put all these names by autocomplete into the share dialog. And it can be annoying when you do this frequently.
Within Outlook they have the option to reply to all people who are invited by the meeting appointment.

h4. Suggested Solution
Add an option to the share dialog to add all mentioned users from the current page into the share field. So i can individually remove single persons or add additional users.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Any edits to a page containing a JIRA issue link inside a panel macro will trigger an update to the JIRA issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an application link between JIRA and Confluence
# Create an issue on JIRA
# Edit a page in Confluence to add a panel. Copy the JIRA issue URL into the panel to create a link.
# On JIRA, check the *History* tab for the issue to confirm the link was created:
!link-created.png|thumbnail!
# Edit the Confluence page on any way (for example, adding some text) and publish it.
# Check the *History* tab on the JIRA issue again. Notice how an entry was added:
!issue-updated.png|thumbnail! 
# Notice how the *Updated* field of the JIRA issue was also changed.

h3. Expected Results
Confluence should not update the JIRA issue.

h3. Actual Results
Every time an edit is made to the page, Confluence will update *all JIRA issues linked* to the page.

h3. Notes
* Could only reproduce if the JIRA issue is inside a panel macro. Could affect other macros as well.
* This bug does not affect Confluence 6.0.1 or 5.10.8.
* JIRA version does not seem to influence the occurrence of this bug. Tested with JIRA 6.4.13 and 7.2.4 with the same results.

h3.Workaround
Move the issue macro outside the panel. Upgrading to Confluence 5.10.8 or higher should solve the issue.
fields.summary: Page edits trigger an update to all JIRA issues linked

h5. Problem statement
Currently, if you import a space from another instance, the page IDs of those imported pages will be different than what it previously was in the original instance.

This makes it harder for links that have been inserted into the pages and are hardcoded, as they have to be manually changed one by one.

h5. Suggestion
It would be great if the page IDs in the destination instance would be preserved from the source instance. This way, the hardcoded links won't be affected and users won't have to manually change all the hardcoded links on the pages.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45095].
  {panel}

This happens when a page or attachment is added or deleted while there is an open editing session on a page that either links to the deleted/added page or uses the attachment.

*Steps to reproduce*

* Create a page and insert an image into it. Publish it.
* Click edit to start a new draft.
* Go to the attachments screen of the page and delete the attached image
* Go back to the page and press edit

*Actual behaviour*

* The editor still shows the attachment

*Expected behaviour*

* The editor should show "Unknown attachment"

This happens because the editor format of the page changes even though the page does not get edited. However, Synchrony still has the old editor format.

This is also true for links and macros. For example, deleting a page that was linked to from another page results in this same behavior, as well as deleting a plug-in while one of its macros is used on a page. The page in edit mode still looks like the macro is present even though in view mode it shows up as "Unknown macro."

*Workaround*

The workaround is to publish the page if this happens. Publishing the page forces Synchrony to get the new editor format. The editor format will now say correctly "Unknown attachment" or "Unknown macro" or will point to a non-existent link. The real solution in that case is to remove that part of the page or replace it with the new attachment or link.
fields.summary: Deleting an attachment, page, or plugin outside the editor does not update the editor format

h3. Summary
Jira custom field in Cyrillic causes sorting in Jira issues macros to break

h3. Environment
* Confluence 5.10.6
* Jira

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a app link between Confluence and Jira
# Create a custom field in a jira project and give it a name with Cyrillic characters "Приоритет Кама"
# Edit couple of issues and add values to the the custom field
# Create a page on confluence and add a jira issues macro
# add JQL-query: project = "Your test project"
# In the display option add the custom field to be displayed 
# Save the page
# Issue facing
## Sort using the custom field "Приоритет Кама"
## Sort using any other field

h3. Expected Results
# You should be able to sort using the custom field
# You should be able to sort using any field without breaking the view.

h3. Actual Results
# You can't sort using the custom field and refresh the filter and the custom field will appear to be empty.
# The view breaks and shows ? and broken characters, the more you click on the sort the more you get. Along with a message "JIRA project doesn't exist or you don't have permission to view it."
# The Jira Issue Macro will not render the Issue details and "Data cannot be retrieved due to an unexpected error* appear in the macro.
fields.summary: Jira custom field with special chars causes sorting in Jira issues macros to break

# This can make it difficult to determine the names of who made contributions to each version of the page.

The text prompt can be confusing for some users. They see the large Page Title indicator but then don't understand that the whole rest of the box is for adding content. They don't seem to take the next step of hitting Tab or Enter or using the mouse to the area below Page Title. 
h3. Suggested Solution
Add a temporary text prompt like "Add contents here" like the "Page Title" prompt so that users know they add content in the same section. An example of what that would look like can be found in the screenshot below: 
 !edit_prompt.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Clarify the text editor by adding a prompt beneath the page title

h3. Problem Definition
As it stands, the Children Display Macro lists all children pages when it is inserted. It would be useful in some scenarios to have the ability to choose which pages will be listed. For example, when trying to organize child pages under different headings or sections of the main page.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a section to the Children Display Macro settings that lists the child pages with a checkbox to include them or not.
fields.summary: Add the option to select which pages will be shown by the Children Display Macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary
You can set the PDF Export Stylesheet either globally or per space. If you add CSS into the Global PDF Export Stylesheet while the Space PDF Export Stylesheet is empty, the codes for the global PDF export stylesheet will appear in the space PDF export stylesheet as though it was directly added there.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new blank space.
# Navigate to {{Confluence Administration > General Configuration > PDF Stylesheet}}.
# Add some code or the text "GLOBAL" to the text box.
# Navigate to the new space created in step 1 and click on {{Space Tools > Look and Feel > PDF Stylesheet}}.

h3. Expected Results
The PDF Stylesheet for the space should be empty because you've not set anything for the new space.

h3. Actual Results
The global PDF Stylesheet appears in the Space Stylesheet as though it was directly added there.

h3. Note
This behaviour is not seen with Global Space Stylesheet and the Space Stylesheet.
fields.summary: Space PDF Export Stylesheet will show the Global PDF Export Stylesheet if the former is empty

h5. Investigation:

The following markup (by using the built in panel macro with the same configuration) can be exported:
{code}
<ac:structured-macro ac:macro-id="4657f1b1-6d33-4147-b6ee-08b7a10ba377" ac:name="panel" ac:schema-version="1">
  <ac:parameter ac:name="borderColor">#6E6E6E</ac:parameter>
  <ac:parameter ac:name="bgColor">#F1F1F1</ac:parameter>
  <ac:parameter ac:name="titleColor">#000000</ac:parameter>
  <ac:parameter ac:name="borderWidth">0</ac:parameter>
  <ac:parameter ac:name="titleBGColor">#BDBDBD</ac:parameter>
  <ac:parameter ac:name="borderStyle">solid</ac:parameter>
  <ac:parameter ac:name="title">Some title</ac:parameter>
  <ac:rich-text-body>
    <ac:structured-macro ac:macro-id="eb31a430-a27e-42b0-bed4-aad585b528b0" ac:name="tip" ac:schema-version="1">
      <ac:rich-text-body>
        <p>Tip inside regular macro</p>
      </ac:rich-text-body>
    </ac:structured-macro>
  </ac:rich-text-body>
</ac:structured-macro>
{code}

The markup for the macro (as shown in the storage format is):
{code}
  <ac:structured-macro ac:macro-id="6421b527-b06c-4ce0-aca6-c53681fd88ed" ac:name="commandpanel" ac:schema-version="1">
    <ac:parameter ac:name="Title">Some other title</ac:parameter>
    <ac:parameter ac:name="atlassian-macro-output-type">INLINE</ac:parameter>
    <ac:rich-text-body>
      <ac:structured-macro ac:macro-id="bcd78f07-1426-4dc5-a5b4-23cfb6353e49" ac:name="tip" ac:schema-version="1">
        <ac:rich-text-body>
          <p>Tip inside custom macro</p>
        </ac:rich-text-body>
      </ac:structured-macro>
    </ac:rich-text-body>
  </ac:structured-macro>
{code}

The inability to export also affects a space export to PDF - which can make finding the offending page quite difficult. Adding debug logging to the flyingpdf class doesn't provide any useful output - this was found with trial and error.

This also applies to variations of {{tip}} - such as {{error}} and {{info}}.
 
h5. Workaround:
 # Move the {{tip}} macro outside the command panel
fields.summary: A custom panel macro with a tip in it cannot be exported to PDF

h3. Problem Definition
The way changes to task lists are displayed in the Confluence notification e-mails are difficult to read. Currently, the diff process shows a very small, light-blue highlight between the checkbox and the text which can be difficult to view.

 !task_list_email_diff.png|thumbnail!

Make changes to the e-mail notifications for task list items to be more visible by only including lines that were actually changed or make the change more visible.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Users are not able to log in and searching for the user yields and NPE error because the user is not present in the user_mapping table.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

We have not found full steps to reproduce yet, but have seen several instances of this.
 # Run the following query against the database:
{code:java}
SELECT * FROM user_mapping where username = '<user name>';
{code}

h3. Expected Results

User has an entry with the {{user_mapping}} table.
{code:java}
             user_key             | username | lower_username
----------------------------------+----------+----------------
 8a80808a549976be0154ab7b19440006 | admin    | admin
{code}
While searching for this users in the user directory, the following error message is displayed:
{code}
Cause
java.lang.NullPointerException
    at com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkNotNull(Preconditions.java:187)
Stack Trace:[hide]
java.lang.NullPointerException
    at com.google.common.base.Preconditions.checkNotNull(Preconditions.java:187)
    at com.google.common.collect.ImmutableList$Builder.add(ImmutableList.java:583)
    at com.google.common.collect.ImmutableList$Builder.add(ImmutableList.java:566)
    at com.google.common.collect.ImmutableCollection$Builder.addAll(ImmutableCollection.java:324)
    at com.google.common.collect.ImmutableList$Builder.addAll(ImmutableList.java:600)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.api.model.pagination.PageResponseImpl$Builder.addAll(PageResponseImpl.java:189)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.api.model.pagination.PageResponseImpl.from(PageResponseImpl.java:94)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.api.impl.pagination.PaginationServiceImpl.lambda$doRequestInTransaction$387(PaginationServiceImpl.java:146)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.api.impl.pagination.PaginationServiceImpl$$Lambda$238/516446270.doInTransaction(Unknown Source)
    at org.springframework.transaction.support.TransactionTemplate.execute(TransactionTemplate.java:128)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.api.impl.pagination.PaginationServiceImpl.doRequestInTransaction(PaginationServiceImpl.java:141)
...
{code}

You may also see these items in the {{atlassian-confluence.log}}
{code}
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException: Unable to find user mapping for <user name>
    at com.atlassian.confluence.user.DefaultPersonalInformationManager.getOrCreatePersonalInformation(DefaultPersonalInformationManager.java:66)
    at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor858.invoke(Unknown Source)
    at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
    at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
    at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:302)
    at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.invokeJoinpoint(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:190)
    at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:157)
    at com.atlassian.spring.interceptors.SpringProfilingInterceptor.invoke(SpringProfilingInterceptor.java:16)
    at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179)
    at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionInterceptor$1.proceedWithInvocation(TransactionInterceptor.java:99)
    at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionAspectSupport.invokeWithinTransaction(TransactionAspectSupport.java:281)
    at org.springframework.transaction.interceptor.TransactionInterceptor.invoke(TransactionInterceptor.java:96)
    at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179)
    at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:208)
    at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy78.getOrCreatePersonalInformation(Unknown Source)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.user.crowd.UserIndexingListener.ensurePersonalInformationAndReindex(UserIndexingListener.java:165)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.user.crowd.UserIndexingListener.onCrowdUserUpdatedEvent(UserIndexingListener.java:134)
    at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor1879.invoke(Unknown Source)
    at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
    at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
    at com.atlassian.event.internal.SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker.invoke(SingleParameterMethodListenerInvoker.java:36)
    ... 51 more
{code}

h3. Actual Results

User does not have an entry in the {{user_mapping}} table and you receive an empty result:
{code:java}
user_key | username | lower_username
--------------------------------
(0 rows)
{code}

h3. Workaround

*Workaround 1: Finding the user_mapping key from a previous database backup and restoring it manually*
# Restore a database dump to a new database or an old xml backup to a new instance
# Run the following SQL query against your restored database dump/restored instance to find the user mapping key for that user:
{code:sql}
SELECT * FROM user_mapping WHERE username='<user name>';
{code}
# Then run this query against your instance to restore the user_key:
{code:sql}
INSERT INTO user_mapping VALUES ('<user_key_from_previous_query>', '<user name>', '<user name>');
{code}

*Workaround 2: Replacing the user_mapping entry with a new user_key*
(!) Please note that *this workaround is not recommended* and is provided for informational purposes. Userkeys need to be unique and generating them randomly can cause failures down the line. If you have any information regarding changes made to the user account prior to this issue appearing, please let us know.

 # Use the following SQL query to *add the entry manually:*
{code:sql}
INSERT INTO user_mapping VALUES ('2c9681954172cf560000000000000001', '<user name>', '<user name>');
{code}
 ** Note that both the <user name> above has to be in all *lowercase*
 ** Always back up your data before performing any modifications to the database. If possible, test any insert, update, or delete SQL commands on a staging server first.

Make sure that:
 # Confluence is shut down before performing any changes to the database
 # After performing the workarounds, [Rebuild the Content Indexes from Scratch|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+rebuild+the+content+indexes+from+scratch]
fields.summary: User unable to login and searching for this user yields NPE error

h3. Summary
Sometimes, at random, when a user inserts text into a page in Confluence followed by a link (created via 'Insert Link), if the user saves the page and goes back into edit mode, the page will convert the text next to the link into hyperlink format, with a nonexistent link.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page in Confluence and add 10-20 lines of text (doesn't have to be more than a few words), followed by a link created via 'Insert Link' macro.
# Publish page
# Go back into Edit mode. Some of the text next to links should now be blue and underlined.
# If this doesn't happen, add more text and links and repeat.

h3. Expected Results
Links should be added and the rest of the text should remain normal.

h3. Actual Results
Other text is converted into a hyperlink format
 
h3. Notes
Screenshot attached.

h3.Workaround
Delete incorrectly formatted text and re-type it, or copy and paste the correctly formatted text after deleting hyperlink formatted text.
fields.summary: Text next to hyperlink sometimes converts to hyperlink format
Crowd SSO configuration

fields.description:
After about an hour or two I tried to edit another page in our Confluence 6.0 rc5 test instance.
I got an error when trying to edit the page. This seems to be a timeout issue with our JDBC JNDI pool used for communicating with the Confluence database. I attach a combined log of atlassian-confluence.log, atlassian-synchrony.log and MySQL server log.
 [^synchrony-communication-error.log] 
The MySQL server seems to abort a connection after some time because there was no response to data delivered to the synchrony client. I made sure that the MySQL server was running. There was definitely no connection problem to the server as several page where retrieved and open in Confluence.
Is this due to a misconfiguration or a general error in Synchrony?
When I retried editing a page another hour later, the problem didn't exist any more. Might be an issue with reusing a database connection which has been idle/closed when not being used for some time.
Regards,
Jan-Peter


*Solution:*
We will make the connection pool's parameters of Synchrony configurable via the system properties. Basically, a Confluence administrator can set the following properties:
* synchrony.database.test.connection.on.checkin (default: true)
* synchrony.database.idle.connection.test.period (defualt: 1800 seconds, or 30 minutes)
* synchrony.database.max.idle.time.excess.connections (default: 1800 seconds, or 30 minutes)
* synchrony.database.max.idle.time (default: 10800 seconds, or 3 hours)
fields.summary: The editor stops loading the page after an hour or two because the JDBC connection is expired

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45045].
  {panel}

h2. Problem summary 
According to https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Page+Restrictions, the Request Access feature works by notifying users who are able to grant restriction access to a page, using this logic in order:
{quote}
# The last person to edit the page
# *All* non-admin users that can set permissions on the page (given that an admin user can always set permissions)
# The page creator
# *All* the space administrators
{quote}

Step 4 is failing. No space admins are notified despite space permission settings. What appears to be happening instead is that a single Confluence superuser (i.e. a member of the "confluence-administrators" group) will be notified. If there are more than one user in this group, the first username on this list, sorted alphabetically, will be sent the request access notification. This user does not need to be in a space administrator for the relevant content. In fact, it doesn't matter who is a space admin on that space, as that configuration does not appear to affect the behavior.

h2. Steps to reproduce
# Set up a Confluence
# Create 5 users:
** UserA
** UserB
** UserC
** SuperX - place this user in confluence-administrators group (superuser)
** SuperY - place this user in confluence-administrators group (superuser)
# Create a space with UserA, so that this user is automatically a space admin
# Create a page with UserB within this space
# Using SuperX, restrict the page so that only SuperX can view it
# Using UserC, try to view the page by going to the page URL directly. The user cannot see it, and will be asked to request access. Click through.

h2. Expected behavior
UserA receives the notification, because although he is not the page creator or the last person to edit the page, he is a full space admin and can set page restrictions.

h2. Actual behavior
SuperX receives the notification, because he is the first superuser alphabetically.

Now rename SuperX to SuperZ, and repeat step 6. Observe that now SuperY is the one who receives the notification, since that is the first superuser alphabetically.

h2. Additional notes
There are actually two parts this is issue:
* Space admins are being ignored in the Request Access logic
* Only one admin is notified, not all, as detailed in the documentation
fields.summary: Request Access feature does not notify space administrators as expected

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

h3. Problem Definition

It would be useful for some customers to have the ability to force Confluence to show only absolute dates, instead of relative ones. The main reason is to avoid the inherited confusion that relative dates can cause, particularly in scenarios where people work from different time zones.

h3. Suggested Solution

JIRA currently have this option as documented on the following page:

* [Disable relative dates in JIRA applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/disable-relative-dates-in-jira-applications-414187622.html]

The solution could be similar to the one available on JIRA.

h3. Workaround 

There is no known workaround for this issue at this moment.
fields.summary: As an Administrator I want to configure Confluence to use only absolute dates

Confirming that there is an issue with non-romantic language characters in the organisation name, which results in Confluence not being able to communicate with Synchrony.

Confluence Product Management

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45026].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The installer ignores unsupported platforms and will run upgrade regardless of the database version, for example.
h3. Suggested Solution
Add a mechanism to the installer to check an existing installation for supported platforms before upgrading.
h3. Workaround 
Manually check the [supported platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Supported+Platforms] before upgrading.
fields.summary: As an administrator I would like the installer to detect supported platforms prior to upgrading

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Confluence Application Status Servlet return HTTP 200 when the node is in cluster panic mode and the header {{Accept-Language}} is missing. Hazelcast at this point is not active for this node, and having an http status check on a load balancer will cause this check to fail and still consider the node to be active while it is not.


h3. Environment
Confluence Data Center with Load Balancer (this was tested with HAProxy)


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure Confluence Data Center with more than 1 node
# Configure HAProxy with
{code:java}
option httpchk GET /confluence/status
http-check expect status 200
{code}
# Try to trigger a panic mode for one of the nodes


h3. Expected Results
Two options:
# The ApplicationStatusServlet will return an HTTP 500 error and HAProxy will stop redirecting requests to the node in Panic
# The ApplicationStatusServlet will return an HTTP 200 OK with the status page reflecting the status STOPPED of the node


h3. Actual Results
HAProxy is still redirecting requests to that node because it received an HTTP 200. On the other hand, accessing the status page from the browser does indeed return an empty page with a 500 HTTP response code


This is an example of a call initiated from CURL:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
curl -i -X GET <base-url>/status
{code}

Response:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1
X-ASEN: SEN-L123456
X-Confluence-Cluster-Node: d1111f1
Content-Type: application/json;charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Length: 19
Date: Fri, 04 Nov 2016 11:12:02 GMT
{code}


On the other hand, simulating the call from the browser, the following header is specifically added to the request
{code:borderStyle=solid}
curl -i -X GET -H 'Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.8' <base-url>/status
{code}


Response: 
{code:borderStyle=solid}
HTTP/1.1 500 Internal Server Error
Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1
Set-Cookie: JSESSIONID=319B13A07E775E53BBAD5E72445B2308; Path=/; HttpOnly
Content-Type: text/html
Content-Length: 0
Date: Fri, 04 Nov 2016 11:10:14 GMT
Connection: close
{code}

h3. Workaround
The available workaround is to modify the haproxy configuration to include the Accept Language header in the request
{code:java}

http-check expect status 200 
{code}
(!) HTTP 1.1 is not compatible in this case and it only works with HTTP 1.0

fields.description:
h4. Steps to repoduce
# Create a test page and add *edit* restriction only to userA
# In the same page assign tasks to userB who has *no* edit permission to the page
# Try to complete the task
# userB can't complete and message is shown:
# Check userB profile >> Tasks
# userB can't complete and same message is shown.

h4. Use case for this report
These tasks will remain *indefinitely*, unless restriction are given, task removed or assignee changed, in the user inlinetasks page as the userB (mentioned user for the task) can't *edit* them.

h4. Proposal
When restrictions are applied, we shouldn't be able to @mention an user for a task that he has *no edit restriction* as he will not be able to interact with it. 

h4. Workaround
# Ask an user to remove/change the assignee
# Ask an user remove the task
# Give restriction ability to userB
fields.summary: Restrict @mention to a task when restrictions are applied
The (not so) new page restrictions page dialog should close on ESC
The new copy page dialog should close on ESC

fields.description:
h3. Summary

the [removeAttachmentWithoutNotifications|https://docs.atlassian.com/confluence/latest-server/com/atlassian/confluence/pages/AttachmentManager.html#removeAttachmentWithoutNotifications-com.atlassian.confluence.pages.Attachment-] method removes all versions of an attachment, similar to _removeAttachmentFromServer_.
There is an additional method _removeAttachmentVersionFromServer_, however not a variant to suppress notifications.

Prior to 5.9, the method _removeAttachmentVersionFromServer_ did not send notifications due to a bug.

h3. Environment
 * Confluence Server 5.9.x & 5.10.x

h3. Expected Results

Ability to delete a specified version of an attachment without sending notifications.
fields.summary: Provide method to 'removeAttachmentWithoutNotifications' for a specified version of an attachment

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Cannot edit a page after copy/paste #(hash mark) in Code Block Macro.
 After this user cannot edit the page only save.
h3. Environment
 * Confluence 5.10.7



||browser||for Mac||for Win||
|*Safari* |NG |--- |
|*Chrome* |NG |NG|
|*FireFox*|NG|NG|
|*IE11*|--- |OK|
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit a page
 # Insert a Table(ex. 3 x 2)
 # Insert a Code Block macro into a cell of the table.
 # Copy/Paste #(hash mark) into the Code Block macro. NOTE don't type
 ex. ## Header1 ##

h3. Expected Results

Page is editable after copy/paste the #(hash mark).
h3. Actual Results

Page is NOT Editable after copy/paste the #(hash mark).
h3. Workaround

Save the page once after copy/paste.
fields.summary: Cannot edit a page after copy/paste #(hash mark) in Code Block Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45012].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently there is not a way to have text display vertically in table headings like this: 
!rotate_headings.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
Incorporate a button that allows users to toggle the text vertically or horizontally in the table headers. 
h3. Workaround 
There are ways to create user macros to achieve this functionality as described in [this thread|http://superuser.com/questions/741451/how-do-i-create-vertical-table-headings-in-confuence], however this is only available for Server customers as User macros are not available in Confluence Cloud.
fields.summary: Vertical text in table headers

To be public. I have a request for the source for one of our Confluence 3.0 renderers

thank you,

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45009].
  {panel}

We have encountered a problem with a macro we use in the space filter. We used the "align" macro from the Adaptavist Content Formatting plugin, but, in the latest version (4.4.3) they have removed the wiki markup functionality from their macros since wiki markup is being depreciated in Confluence. Since this has been done, we can no longer align the text since the space footer requires us to use Wiki markup. 

So this request is that you provide a solution that we can use another coding format that will be recognized by Confluence and the macros OR have the ability to insert macros into the footer.

Thank you,
Lisa
fields.summary: Allow other coding formats rather than wiki markup for Space Footer/Header/Sidebar

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45008].
  {panel}

It should be possible to add a member to a "Team Space" after the initial space creation. Currently there is no official way to do that, although it can be worked around by:

* Adding user to space watchers
* Adding user as space admin
* Adding user to grid on space homepage

This was previously reported in

* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-32667
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-38146

However, they were both closed as duplicating each other... Which means that this request is no longer being tracked.
fields.summary: Allow user to add or remove team members from a team space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45007].
  {panel}

h3. Problem

We are not able to insert thumbnails for the attachments in the attachments screen of a page, it would make much easier to identify images if you have a big number of attachments.
h3. Solution

It will be good if a thumbnail of the image can be displayed on the attachment page or as a separate tab like "info" tab.
 In this case, all the images related to the terms can be viewed if the users are interested. 
 And the pages can be "included" in other pages easily without the images cluttering the page.

- Also, it would be good to show a thumbnail of the file's first page on a file list page, as Confluence shows when a file is uploaded to a blank page
h3. Workaround

Add a thumbnail to the page related, it takes an extra step which causes an extra effort form our customers that could be easily avoided
fields.summary: Display thumbnails of attached images/files
Ability to add a "today" line to Roadmap Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-45003].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Site Backups are no longer downloadable via /webdav/backupmanager, but downloadable instead via the temp directory (with URLs like /wiki/download/temp/filestore/ebe7bb18-0229-4907-a86f-f62415e9c135 ). The Site backup itself, is simply named only as Site_Backup.zip (which is ambiguous, and does not have timestamp appended). So essentially, what we need is:
# Documentation on the changes
# A better filename for the site backup file itself, with timestamp appended for ease of administration

This is important for customers managing their backups with scripts to automatically generate the backup and download it.
fields.summary: Document How Confluence Backup Works With The New FileStore (No longer stored at /webdav/backupmanager, and saved only as Site_Backup.zip)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-44996].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Table of Contents macro fonts cannot be modified natively. When a TOC macro is added to a page, it will always display with the default Confluence font and size.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add functionality to make this configurable, or toggle whether the macro inherits styling or not.

This macro used to inherit styles and headings of the rest of the content in Confluence, and some customers were used to this behavior. It would be useful to have a configuration option for this: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-32959?focusedCommentId=579537&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-579537

h3. Workaround 
At this point, the only way to change this would be through custom CSS as explained here: [Font Style and Color in Confluence Table of Content Macro - Atlassian Answers|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/188860/font-style-and-color-in-confluence-table-of-content-macro]
fields.summary: Table of Contents macro fonts cannot be modified natively

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When running Confluence 5.10.x + behind a proxy server, PDF exports are extremely slow (upwards of 4 minutes in some cases). This occurs when exporting a page of any size to PDF. 

h3. Environment

* Confluence running behind a reverse proxy (even with the appropriate configuration in server.xml)

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Install Confluence 5.10.x
# Configure Confluence to run behind a proxy
# Export any page to PDF

h3. Expected Results

PDF export completes quickly.

h3. Actual Results
PDF export takes several minutes to complete. The below exception is thrown in the catalina.out log
{noformat}
WARNING [ContainerBackgroundProcessor[StandardEngine[Standalone]]] org.apache.catalina.valves.StuckThreadDetectionValve.notifyStuckThreadDe
tected Thread "http-nio-8090-exec-7" (id=209) has been active for 63,805 milliseconds (since 10/10/16 8:48 PM) to serve the same request for http://marketing.caisgroup.com/wf/click?upn=P9Kozy4bmh4M8yjnh44OgtAhqq-2F-2F8D7n2W92yeJKt7Y-3D_JHlVOQoHtKPdkEiMbjTobJwlXz4IzRQzbYzSGvmGIbK9LpOrv017XjmgWjO2WqjSIzhXA5v46kU3XBOiFMfds2qh6fQrnj5Y9qyWHsRFzP2xWDrzesIkiXGORXeB-2BwiKTFXrfZ-2BXnvLNBRR5IaJ4CTqoSm8QWTcNR2E9L9LZnNXTdBQJV-2Bm3ymMPLPbm2WasOt74V7C6UfKpnzhT80EHh6ta26Yr0pjrjFi6zTraxFxO30-2F7R8tZj18WE8gUmKn-2F
group.com/spaces/flyingpdf/pdfpageexport.action?pageId=5406820 and may be stuck (configured threshold for this StuckThreadDetectionValve is 60 seconds). There is/are 1 thread(s) in total that are monitored by this Valve and may be stuck.
{noformat}
The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-confluence.log:
{noformat}
2016-10-10 20:50:11,686 WARN [http-nio-8090-exec-7] [confluence.util.profiling.DefaultActivityMonitor] close Exceeded the threshold of 60000 ms: ActivitySnapshot{startTime=1476146884364, threadId=209, threadName='http-nio-8090-exec-7', userId='xxx', type='web-request', summary='/spaces/flyingpdf/pdfpageexport.action?pageId=pageid'}
 -- url: /spaces/flyingpdf/pdfpageexport.action | traceId: 728a88e5d180b96b | userName: xxx | referer: https://baseURL/pages/viewpage.action?spaceKey=SPC&title=TitleofDoc
{noformat}

Prior to this, we can see that the PDF export itself completes fairly quickly: 
{noformat}2016-08-30 16:26:00,234 DEBUG [http-nio-8443-exec-19] [extra.flyingpdf.html.RenderedXhtmlBuilder] renderToHtml Rendering to exported XHTML page id=4391148 (Adjust session time-out value)
2016-08-30 16:26:00,243 DEBUG [http-nio-8443-exec-19] [extra.flyingpdf.html.AutoFontScaleUtils] applyTableScalingLogic Total scaling time : 0
2016-08-30 16:30:14,798 DEBUG [http-nio-8443-exec-19] [confluence.extra.flyingpdf.FlyingSaucerXmlToPdfConverter] open PDF document open
2016-08-30 16:30:14,799 DEBUG [http-nio-8443-exec-19] [confluence.extra.flyingpdf.FlyingSaucerXmlToPdfConverter] setPageCount PDF document setPageCount 1
2016-08-30 16:30:14,801 DEBUG [http-nio-8443-exec-19] [confluence.extra.flyingpdf.FlyingSaucerXmlToPdfConverter] newPage PDF document newPage
2016-08-30 16:30:14,802 DEBUG [http-nio-8443-exec-19] [confluence.extra.flyingpdf.FlyingSaucerXmlToPdfConverter] close PDF document closed
2016-08-30 16:30:14,804 WARN [http-nio-8443-exec-19] [confluence.util.profiling.DefaultActivityMonitor] close Exceeded the threshold of 60000 ms: ActivitySnapshot{startTime=1472538360232, threadId=196, threadName='http-nio-8443-exec-19', userId='admin', type='web-request', summary='/spaces/flyingpdf/pdfpageexport.action?pageId=pageid'}
 -- url: /spaces/flyingpdf/pdfpageexport.action | traceId: 34c44df638fa91b8 | userName: xxx | referer: https://baseURL/display/SYS/doctitle{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
It appears that the PDF is actually exported to the temp directory fairly quickly and the GET request is what is taking a long time. Looking at a HAR file, pdfpageexport.action {{https://baseURL/spaces/flyingpdf/pdfpageexport.action?pageId=65541"}} is throwing a 302. The location of the request is {{/download/temp/pdfexport-20160831-310816-1646-18/ds-documentname-310816-1646-19.pdf?contentType=application/pdf}}.

h3.Workaround
Add an entry in /etc/hosts that resolves the proxy server address to the localhost IP:

{code}127.0.0.1    proxy.url.com{code}
If you are using a web proxy, you will also need to update "http.nonProxyHosts" and "https.nonProxyHosts" list with the domain name of the application "proxy.url.com".
fields.summary: Extremely slow PDF export in Confluence 5.10.x while running behind a proxy

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-44993].
  {panel}

Currently, the number of tasks to display on each page of results in the table are 10, 20 or 40.

Allow to choose in a wider range.  _n_ values.

h4. Workaround
Download and use the [Source Editor Plugin, it is free|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.editor.confluence-source-editor/server/overview]. 

You will see, after installing, that when you go to the editor mode of a page, in the right upper corner, you will find *< >* option, click on it, and you will see something similar to:
{code}
....
<ac:structured-macro ac:name="tasks-report-macro">
          <ac:parameter ac:name="spaces">BSP</ac:parameter>
          <ac:parameter ac:name="status">complete</ac:parameter>
          <ac:parameter ac:name="assignees">
            <ri:user ri:userkey="2c9682654373c47f014373caa68a0003"/>
          </ac:parameter>
          <ac:parameter ac:name="spaceAndPage">space:BSP,page:2555905</ac:parameter>
          <ac:parameter ac:name="pages">2555905</ac:parameter>
          <ac:parameter ac:name="labels">meeting-notes</ac:parameter>
          <ac:parameter ac:name="pageSize">10</ac:parameter>
        </ac:structured-macro>
....
{code}
These are the macro parameter, and you can manually change the {{<ac:parameter ac:name="pageSize">10</ac:parameter>}} to 5 and save it. It will now only show 5 tasks. But, first, you need to choose the parameter in the macro, while editing it (in editor mode), for it to show in the source of it.
fields.summary: Task Report Macro: Allow n number of tasks shown

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-44984].
  {panel}

h3. *Summary*
In the new Confluence release, as mentioned *[here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/2015/05/29/Upcoming+Atlassian+Cloud+Upgrade+for+week+starting+31+May+2015]*, the table headers in Confluence Cloud is supposed to stick to the top when large tables are scrolled.
PS: The sticky header will not work when the user edited the table. If user copies and pastes back the table, the sticky table will work. However, when they edited the table, the sticky table will stop working.

h3. *Steps to reproduce*:
# Create blank page
# Create a large table, with header
# Save the page
# Sticky table will not work.
# Edit the page
# Copy the table
# Delete the table and paste the table again
# Save the page.
# Sticky header works
(i) For details behavior please review the attached video.

*Observed Behaviour*
Try to scroll and header will not be sticky on the top

*Expected Behaviour*
The table header will stick when we scroll the page.

h3.Video
 [^Recording #15.mp4]
fields.summary: Sticky header for table not working after edit

fields.description:
Environment:

*JIRA 7.1.4*
 *JIRA 7.1.6*
 *Confluence 5.10.8*

(i) Cannot replicate this with Confluence 5.8.18 or Confluence 5.9.9. Can replicate it with Confluence 5.10.0 and Confluence 5.10.7 as well.

Steps to Reproduce:
 Create Application Links between Confluence 5.10.8 to both JIRA instances

JIRA 7.1.4 has the following projects:
 !jira714_projects.png|thumbnail!

JIRA 7.1.6 has the following projects:
 !jira716_projects.png|thumbnail!

Highlight some text on a Confluence page and select "Create JIRA issue":
 !create_jira_issue.png|thumbnail!

The JIRA set a primary will be displayed with it's projects:
 !jira716_selected.png|thumbnail!

However, if you change for the other JIRA instance linked to your Confluence, the project list won't be updated:
 !jira714_selected.png|thumbnail!

If you end up clicking on "Create" and the project doesn't exist on your JIRA instance, the issue creation screen will keep spinning until times out. Logs won't show any stacktrace.
h2. Resolution

The recommended resolution is to upgrade to Confluence 6.2.3 and above when it is released.

If upgrading is not possible and you are running Confluence 6.0.2 or above, an alternative is to upgrade the JIRA content plugin to 2.0.5 or newer which can be downloaded here: [^confluence-jira-content-2.0.5.jar] Note that this version of the plugin is only known to work with Confluence 6.0.2 and above.
fields.summary: Creating JIRA issues from Confluence is not updating the project list based on the selected JIRA instance selection

h2. Bug

If you try to drag an image attached to a page to another part of the page (*not in editor*), the process creates a copy of the attachment and inserts a "[X]" number after the file name as we can see in the screenshot below:

!image_dragging.jpg|thumbnail!
h3. Environment

This only happens on IE browsers. it cannot be replicated on Firefox or Chrome.
h3. Expected behavior

Dragging images should not create new copies of the files
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround at the moment. Using Firefox or Chrome does not replicate the issue so they are recommended.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If you run Confluence over HTTPS, Edit in Office on Microsoft Office 2007 does not work.
h3. Environment

Server side: Confluence running over HTTPS
 Office Connector version: 3.4.18
 Client side: Windows 7, IE11, Office 2007
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Confluence 5.8.5
 # Configure Confluence to run over HTTPS (tested using self signed certificate)
 # Make sure to check "Allow authentication tokens in the URL path" in Office Connector settings
 # Create a new page
 # No restrictions on the page
 # Upload a new Word or Excel document
 # Save the page. Wait for 1 minute for the document to be converted
 # Click on Edit in Office in IE11
 # Document will be downloaded locally
 # Word/Excel will open and will ask the user for username and password authentication

h3. Expected Results

User should enter their Confluence username and password and the document should open in Edit Mode.
h3. Actual Results

Authentication fails and the document is open in read-only.
h3. Workaround

The only available workarounds are:
 # Update your Microsoft Office to 2010 or 2013
 # Disable HTTPS (but this will break Office 2013 because of a restriction from Microsoft)
fields.summary: Edit in Office over HTTPS fails on Office 2007

h4. Summary
Enterprise customers or those with very large spaces are unable to move large page trees successfully. 

This is using the built-in "move" function. This doesn't involve the copy page tree plugin at all. 

The customer who experienced this is on 5.8.18. I also tested on 5.9.14 and was able to reproduce the issue in my lab.

h4. Environment
* Confluence 5.8.18 through 6.6.4
* I have attached an xml-backup from my 5.9.14 test instance

h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Create fresh instance
# Create test space
# Populate test space with ~60,000 pages
# Attempt to move entire page tree somewhere

# Move fails after 3 minutes exactly

h4. Expected Results
Page tree is moved successfully

fields.description:
h3. Summary

External gadget titles are garbled while editing a page if the user language preference is set to Japanese.

 
h3. Environment
 * Confluence 5.10.7
 * JIRA 7.2.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an application link between Confluence and JIRA
 # [Register|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Registering+External+Gadgets] the following JIRA gadgets
 !external-gadgets.png|thumbnail!
 -- Activity Stream
 -- Pie Chart
 -- Issue Statistics
 -- Two Dimensional Filter Statistics
 # Restart Confluence
 (i) This step is important! If you have ever done the following steps in other languages than Japanese until the restart, you will not be reproduce this bug.
 # Change your language preference to Japanese
 # Open a page in edit mode
 # Add the above external JIRA gadgets from *+ (Insert more contents) > Other macros*
 (i) Do not confuse the gadgets with *JIRA Macros*, *JIRA Chart Macros* and the existing *Activity Stream*. The problem about the existing *Activity Stream* has already been reported as another bug here.

h3. Expected Results

The gadget titles shouldn't be garbled.
h3. Actual Results

The gadget titles were garbled as follows.

!garbled-gadgets.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes
 * Even though we installed appropriate fonts files in both of Confluence and JIRA with following the instruction --CONF-36557--, this problem was happened
 * After saving the page, there seems to be no problem at all. All the contents was shown correctly.

h3. Workaround

Use JIRA Macros and JIRA Chart Macros instead.
fields.summary: External gadget titles are garbled while editing a page

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-44935].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Customer reported that, in Confluence pages, links are distinguished by color only. 

Confluence Cloud version does not allow CSS Customization. You are able to change links color (look and feel configuration settings), however, it changes All links within Confluence application, this is only regarding the ones on pages text. 

There is also a best practice, for accessibility, from w3 on how to display links described here: [https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG20-TECHS/F73.html]

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be better if we add something like underlining or shading, into the style that links are displayed, even better if we make an option to change default link styles (for pages only)

h3. Workaround 
The only suitable workaround for this would be to manually format links in a way that differs it from the text.
fields.summary: Distinguish Links from text

h3.Workarounds
# After pasting the content on Confluence, make sure to change the preformatted text to the one Confluence uses.
# Paste the text into another text editor, copy from there and then paste it on Confluence.
fields.summary: Not able to save page when Copy&Paste preformatted text from web
Show page information before deleting

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-44931].
  {panel}

We'd like to see exceptions for the JIRA workflow transitions. For example
- Open a Pull Request = move ticket to 'Ready for Review'
- Open a Pull Request with 'WIP' in the title = do not move

Other ideas include different rules based on the labels assigned in GitHub, but we'd really love to see the title based exclusions be implemented.
fields.summary: JIRA workflow transitions - exceptions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-44930].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

* create empty page
* insert excerpt macro using { notation then write something inside then hit the down arrow
* insert second excerpt macro using { notation then write something inside then hit the down arrow
* insert third excerpt macro using { notation and write something inside
* check that all three macros have the "inline" display option selected (by clicking on the macro placeholder to show the property panel)
* update the page to go back into the page view mode
* result shared-drafts turned on: spans are on three different lines
* result shared-drafts turned off: spans are on the same line
fields.summary: BR elements between inline macros

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-44929].
  {panel}

User should not be prompted if he has read only access to the page containing Office documents.
1) The request is to allow access if user have read access.
The request is also to refuse to save (or request prompt for login password with higher credentials at save).
2) The request is also to keep the "edit document" link when user is in read only. It is very important as I explained. When you remove it, users start to download documents and then they start also to break formulas that cross documents.
3) Optionally, you can leave the prompt if the user has not even read access, this will alert him something is wrong.
fields.summary: Office documents is read only pages shouldn't prompt users to provide their credentials
